data.title: Kelly Clarkson
data.text:
Kelly Brianne Clarkson (born April 24, 1982) is an American singer-songwriter and actress who has enjoyed success in the pop and rock music genres. Clarkson made her debut under RCA Records after she won the highly publicized first season of the television series American Idol in 2002.

Quotes

[edit]

I'm usually barefoot. That's how I'm most comfortable. I like my feet to be on the ground. I like to jump around, I like to fly across the stage.

From Entertainment Weekly, December 24, 2003

Lyrics

[edit]

Thankful (2003)

[edit]

This sad story always ends the same

Me standing in the pouring rain.

"The Trouble with Love Is", written by Clarkson, Evan Rogers and Carl Sturken

She looked in the mirror and thought today

'What happened to miss no-longer-afraid?'

"Miss Independent", written by Clarkson, Christina Aguilera, Rhett Lawrence, and Matt Morris

Breakaway (2004)

[edit]

Here I am, once again,

I'm torn into pieces.

Can't deny it, can't pretend;

Just thought you were the one.

Broken up, deep inside,

But you won't get to see the tears I cry

Behind these hazel eyes.

"Behind These Hazel Eyes", written by Clarkson, Max Martin, and Dr. Luke

Because of you

I never stray too far from the sidewalk.

Because of you

I learned to play on the safe side so I don't get hurt.

Because of you

I find it hard to trust not only me, but everyone around me.

Because of you, I am afraid.

"Because of You", written by Clarkson, David Hodges, and Ben Moody

I've always dreamed that love would be effortless

Like a petal falling to the ground; a dreamer following his dream.

"Where Is Your Heart?", written by Clarkson, Hodges, and Moody

I'm looking for attention, not another question.

Should you stay or should you go?

Well, if you don't have the answer,

Why are you still standin' here?

Hey, hey, hey, hey,

Just walk away.

"Walk Away", written by Clarkson, Kara DioGuardi, Chantal Kreviazuk, and Raine Maida

I'm restless and wild

I fall, but I try

I need someone to understand.

"Hear Me", written by Clarkson, DioGuardi, and Clif Magness

I hope the ring you gave to her turns her finger green.

I hope when you're in bed with her, you think of me.

I would never wish bad things, but I don't wish you well.

Could you tell, by the flames that burned your words?

"Never Again", written by Clarkson and Jimmy Messer

Remember all the things we wanted?

Now all our memories, they're haunted.

We were always meant to say goodbye,

Even with our fists held high.

It never would've worked out right, yeah.

We were never meant for do or die.

"Already Gone", written by Clarkson and Ryan Tedder

But piece by piece, he collected me

Up off the ground, where you abandoned things, yeah.

Piece by piece, he filled the holes that you burned in me

At six years old.

And you know, he never walks away,

He never asks for money.

He takes care of me, he loves me.

Piece by piece, he restored my faith

That a man can be kind and a father could stay.

"Piece by Piece", written by Clarkson and Greg Kurstin
